ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Absolutely! My favorite class this year.
Useful for anyone looking to learn more about legal systems, colonial Latin America, or the history of empires in the Atlantic World.

The course provides a tour of recent work on legal history in Latin America. Particular areas of emphasis are the ways in which indigenous people and (ex) slaves used/shaped the law, and the processes by which Early Modern legal codes gave way to constitutionalism. I would enthusiastically recommend the class to anyone interested in Latin American, legal, and/or Atlantic history.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Incredibly helpful -- it gave me the background to ask legal questions of my sources.

Has helped me think about many of these topics from a different angle, which has been tremendously useful for my personal research interests. Not directly related to my dissertation/research interests, but nonetheless influential.
